item.title: item_analysis 0506
item.description: Data Scoring Extract responses only Item analysis Difficulty and Discrimination Score transformation library(CTT) library(psychometric) library(tidyverse) Data key <- read_csv("107ctt_key.csv", col_names = T) ## ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## cols( ## quiz_no = col_character(), ## key = col_character() ## ) dat <- read_csv('107ctt_dat.csv') ## ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## cols( ## .default = col_character(), ## player = col_double() ## ) ## ℹ Use `spec()` for the full column specifications.

item.title: Make Slides by R Markdown Beamer
item.description: 1 R Markdown You follow the basic R presentation way. Do not need any other pkg, but tinytex. 2 YAML settings (the most imp. part) --- title: A minimal example subtitle: With a subtitle author: Matthias Vogelgesang institute: Centre for Modern Beamer Themes date: \today theme: Madrid CJKmainfont: DFKai-SB #標楷體 output: beamer_presentation: latex_engine: xelatex fontsize: 12pt --- use LaTex pkg: {ctex} and {xeCJK} for Chinese fonts. \setCJKmainfont

item.title: 0413 bayesien meta-analysis
item.description: #install.packages("gemtc") #install.packages("netmeta") #install.packages("rjags") library(gemtc) ## Loading required package: coda library(netmeta) ## Loading required package: meta ## Loading 'meta' package (version 4.16-1). ## Type 'help(meta)' for a brief overview. ## ## Attaching package: 'meta' ## The following object is masked from 'package:gemtc': ## ## forest ## Loading 'netmeta' package (version 1.3-0). ## Type 'help("netmeta-package")' for a brief overview. library(rjags) ## Linked to JAGS 4.3.0 ## Loaded modules: basemod,bugs library(rio) library(igraph) ##

item.title: Structural topic modeling: a trial
item.description: link here: structural topic modeling | R Club (uoregon.edu) stmVignette.pdf learning stm using DT and Higher Education #dtc160 <- convert2df( # file = "DTHghEdCov160.bib", # dbsource = "scopus", # format = "bibtex" # ) #dtnc1667 <- convert2df( # file = "DTHghEdNCov1667.bib", # dbsource = "scopus", # format = "bibtex" # ) select variables select Document Title (TI), Keywords associated by SCOPUS or ISI database (ID), Authors’ Keywords (DE) and Abstract (AB), then combined to one variable.

item.title: ConQuest計分檔的分割函數
item.description: 讀取計分檔。 記得用 read_table()，若用 read_csv() 因為是逗點切割，所以會全部分成一個欄位。 tds <- read_table('TDS.txt', col_names = FALSE) ConQuest的計分檔（.txt）用
